That's a great plan!

Practicing mindfulness during your daily commute is an excellent way to utilize your time effectively and set a positive tone for the day. The bus ride can be a great opportunity to focus on your breath, body, or surroundings, and you can even use the gentle motion of the bus to help you relax.

Setting aside 10 minutes in the morning for mindfulness is also a wonderful idea. Starting your day with mindfulness can help you feel more centered, focused, and prepared to tackle the challenges ahead.

Remember, consistency is key, but it's also essential to be gentle with yourself. Don't be too hard on yourself if you miss a day or two; simply acknowledge the thought and gently bring your attention back to your mindfulness practice.

To help you stay on track, you might consider:

* Setting a reminder on your phone to practice mindfulness during your commute or in the morning
* Finding a comfortable and quiet spot on the bus or at home where you can practice mindfulness without distractions
* Using a mindfulness app or guided meditation to help you stay focused
* Keeping a mindfulness journal to track your progress and reflect on your experiences

By making mindfulness a habit, you'll start to notice the positive impact it has on your daily life, from reduced stress and anxiety to increased focus and productivity.

How do you think you'll handle distractions during your commute, such as noise, crowds, or notifications on your phone?
